attributes.action: STOP commercial Companies profiting from OUR content! - ie abolish UKTV subscription
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I love UKTV also, but do you realise that 50% of this Company is owned by a private firm!

For many years I worked in the graphic design business and regularly if we were short of a skill or talent required to complete a project we would purchase this or "Out Source" it.

This was common practice and the Artist, Sound Engineer or Video Production Company would make what we wanted.

However, the Artist, Sound Engineer or Video Production Company would NOT own the material they made. These people were commissioned to make it on behalf of us. Then we would present the Job on behalf of the Customer. 

If this material was used anywhere else it would almost certainly call the wrath of Solicitors from the Customer and quite rightly.

How then does the BBC justify allowing a private company to re-sell material we commissioned them to make on our behalf in the first place?

Have your say!

You should NOT have to pay UKTV to view BBC output especially when BBC4 and BBC3 do not run in the daytime,

Ownership Details:-
UKTV - BBC and Flextec. (50%,50%)
Flextech is owned by NTL (100%)
NTL is an 'investment company' part owned by Virgin (10.5%)
source London Freelance
